intro: Bocquillonia nervosa, commonly known as the slender nerve-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves with prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pale in color. Bocquillonia nervosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats.
